galleryData.description:
Modern Batik.

This piece was created as a mother's day gift for my family of three.

Ink Drawing.

Too lazy to get food? Going to the Toronto Zoo during one of the coldest Canadian winter was not such a bad idea!

Acrylic on Canvas.

Inspired by the mesmerizing wall of jelly fish during my first visit to Ripley's Aquarium.

Ink Drawing.

Inspired by the red pandas who did not let snow interfere with their journey. Going to the Toronto Zoo during one of the coldest Canadian winter days was not such a bad idea!

Watercolour.

Omning llama from the Eby Farmstead in Waterloo Park.

Watercolour.

Shall we be friends? Stray cat from Jamaica.

Ink Drawing.

Maybe you should look away. Going to the Toronto Zoo during one of the coldest Canadian winter was not such a bad idea!

Ink Drawing.

Inspired by my awesome friend Lucy Fan's bunnies and those good old sleeping parties back in UW. This drawing was also used as the design of my very first card!

Acrylic on Canvas.

Two egrets lingering by the water in anticipation of the slightest ripple.

Dye, Ink and Watercolour.

Fishing for the last berries before the winter hits. Inspired by the vocalists of Sunnybrook Park.

Modern Batik.

Inspired by various fantasy games that I grew up with; this piece was created during the "2010 Modern Batik Art Workshop RISE UP!".

Acrylic on Canvas.

An egret perched on driftwood, staring into the water in solidtude.
